We're not going to have that anymore.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Everything is going to be up on Twitter. There's going to be no parchment paper with stuff. Every thought and every feeling, every attack is going to be highly readable. It's going to be immortal and worthless.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. You mean like the Gettysburg Address? And this stuff...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, Twitter replaces that. You don't need it anymore.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Just a Twitter address.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Juan asked Dana to talk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but his point was so mundane that I haven't...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Are you still talking?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can't stop. Let -- let the lady have the floor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's sexist. "Let the lady have the floor"? This isn't a dance club.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right, all right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Let me have the -- let me have the chair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let the gender-neutral individual -- gender-neutral individual...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think he's playing Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He loves -- he loves talking about Trump. He loves it. He loves when Trump does...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, I don't like the 280 characters. I thought he had a better rhythm at 140. Like, a self-imposed discipline on that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Even if it's three tweets. I thought those were much more fun to read. I also feel like, for as much as President Trump is entertaining his base, LaVar Ball is doing the same.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Everyone has an audience here, and so it's like the -- it is like the reality show. Because I can't wait to tune in tomorrow to see what's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But what would really get President Trump going might be if LaVar Ball thanked Hillary Clinton for some reason.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And then we can keep it going.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You're giving ideas.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I have -- I have two thoughts on this. You have to watch the entire interview. I think he was putting Cuomo on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Of course, definitely.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: People say, "Oh, he's crazy, he's unhinged, he's not real." He went on there. He -- he twisted the thing. He put it on its head. He was Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And I've got to give Mark Cuban credit.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We said that yesterday.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Mark Cuban said Donald Trump and LaVar Ball are really the same.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I said that on "The Five" yesterday. Cuban took it from me.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: In reality, if the president didn't -- no one was pressuring the president to deal for these basketball players. But had he not, they might be in the same slot as that Ball State football player that's been in jail for 13 months for a bar fight in China, who cannot get anyone's attention. His family...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's his name?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: ... is putting -- his family -- I have it right here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Well, why didn't he get him out, too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He should have.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: His name is Wendell Brown. And his family says, "Mr. President, we will thank you every day if you can get my son out."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We've got to get Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: President Trump, get Wendell Brown out. Please.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Free Wendell Brown. Free Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Free Wendell Brown. Free Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: He might be watching.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Certainly. Well, he certainly watches "FOX & Friends."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Because you're here. "FOX & Friends."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What about this -- what about LaVar as Don King?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's pretty funny.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you think it's funny? OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I mean, he said Don King without the hair.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I thought he liked him.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, Don King's a friend of his.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He does. That's why..

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Don King's a Republican.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Don King is his friend. Don King supported him and showed up at his -- so his was trying to -- this guy thinks he's, you know, funny.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: So you think it's over?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... original.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. It's too good. We just did a whole segment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's never over.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We've done it two days in a row on this show. It's not over.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It's your serve, Mr. Ball.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But you know, what point, what Trump is saying, he recognizes that Ball is a showman in progress. When he said "a poor man's Don King", he was basically saying, "I know what you're doing."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "I can help you."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "I can help you. I see where you're going." Because a lot of people call me a poor man's Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's only a matter of time.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Or they call you a poor man.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Everybody says it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's written in the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: By the way, they took -- they didn't just take glasses. They took a lot of stuff, by the way. They could've ended up in a lot of trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: They took a lot of paraphernalia.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's a serious thing. And he did do something wonderful. And, you know, LaVar Ball. Blah, blah, blah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And also, the president on the plane, when he gets asked about it on the flight home, he goes back to see the press, and there's that video. And the president is very restrained in talking about how bad the situation was. And I love -- it was at one point, where he said, "It wasn't good, OK?" He just leaves it at that, and everybody could have just left it at that. Instead, now we have to go over and over it again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm having a great time talking about it. I'd rather talk about this than a lot of other things.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I had fun with that ridiculous tweet, but I must say, I think he has saw self-interest in making himself into the hero of getting the boys back. But now LaVar is trying to thwart that. That's why he's going after LaVar. I don't know. To me, it just looks like two hucksters having a party. Coming up, new greeting recommendations for children during this holiday season. Forget the hugging. How about the high five? We'll explain next.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. How about a high five, Grandpa? The Girl Scouts of America have just issued a warning to parents not to force kids to hug their relatives on the holidays, specifically daughters. Now the group posting a reminder online that says, quote, "Girls don't owe hugs to anyone, not even family members." It suggests the alternatives might be a smile, an air kiss -- are you writing this down, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: An air kiss or whatever is most comfortable for them. Kimberly, is this an important move?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Give an air kiss? Be, like, phony or whatever. And try to -- I don't get this.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Should you tell a 12-year-old to go hug a relative if they're not comfortable with it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes, absolutely. This is why I'm so happy that Dana and I chose to be Campfire Girls.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They would never issue such a foolish, ridiculous statement as the Girl Scouts.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Dana Perino, is this an evolving of our culture to realize we shouldn't just hug people just because they're technically related to us?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm a hugger. I like to hug.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You're a hugger?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I am, and I think that it -- I think it's good. I'm just trying to remember, like, if you see your family once a year, and it was, like, maybe Christmas time. You get up to the ranch, and there's Uncle Joe. I actually did have an Uncle Joe. Like, I want to give Uncle Joe and Aunt Lina a hug.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Of course. It's one moment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Isn't that...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Even if his "Make America Great Again" hat falls off during that hug. Juan, real quick, do you see this as evolving? People worried about 12- and 13-year-old girls may be in an uncomfortable situation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, and I would...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You like this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't like it because I have granddaughters and a daughter. And I...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And you want to get a hug.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Would you tell them not -- don't hug?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would -- I'm very sensitive to the -- if a little kid said to me, "I'm not comfortable," I would say, "Why is that?" Because I think little kids want to hug you and give you a kiss.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think that's different.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I just...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's complaining about something that maybe has gone on a bit, you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Maybe. I don't know what's going on, but if the child is uncomfortable, I would...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I would never force somebody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would -- I would listen to the child. Because if you look at the statistics, the people who are most likely to assault or attack that child...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. Now it's gone off the rails.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And they say one in nine -- one in nine females will have some type of unacceptable interactions with an adult. Greg, finally, think about the adult's feelings. A little kid -- young girl does not want to hug the cousin from another state, because "I haven't seen them." They don't feel comfortable. What about the adults' feelings?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two things. One, I am for this. I hate hugging, especially kids when they're already taller than me. It's a reminder.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Happens a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it happens way too often. You know, this is actually -- to be -- serious point, we are entering this phase where there's this underlying agreement that all men are predators. We're seen -- no matter what. We're just all bad. And I think this is the consequence of that. Of course, I doubt there will be any hugging at Uncle Franken's House. They'll be not hugging. And also Uncle Charlie's.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And no sleeping. Keep your eyes open.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And Uncle Roy, too.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I will say this. For Italian families in Girl Scouts, it's a no-brainer. Italians have to hug. It's the law.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hug.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: They were born to hug. The Irish will welcome this. The Irish are not big emotional.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That should be your memoir, "Born to Hug."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think the Irish are very warm.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Not big huggers.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I hug people.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: "One More Thing" is next. On behalf of the Irish, we don't hug.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We hug.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's time now for "One More Thing." And in a spirit of generosity, Brian, you get to go first.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: All right. So in the next two weeks, "Andrew Jackson: The Miracle of New Orleans" will go on the big screen. It will be on the Fox News Channel at 8 p.m. either this Sunday or next Sunday or the Sunday after. The third or tenth. And Andrew Jackson, as you know, had a big win. It was for America. It's a pro-history story. Here's a look.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: If this berm didn't work, there was another line and another line they'd have to go through before they get into New Orleans, but they never got past this one.

utterances.speaker: DAVID BRINKLEY, PRESIDENTIAL HISTORIAN
utterances.sentences: That's right. This becomes a bloodbath here, the corpses. Now we're just looking at green grass. It was the beginning of the end of Britain and, in many ways, the birth of modern America.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And that's the story of the battle. We fly a drone above it to give you an idea. "Andrew Jackson: Miracle of New Orleans."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That looks great. Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Ron Bredesen (ph) and Dave Brinkley did a great job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're good photos.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. So I have a fantastic little thing of puppy love. "Kimberly's Puppy Love Dating Tips," OK? So this is cute. My friend Anisha has a dog Luigi who I absolutely love. He's super adorable. He's 6 years old, and he's got a lot of style. You see him there in his red cashmere sweater. And he's with a very famous Instagram dog, Sparkles the Diva. She's 7 years old. And she's a Shih-Tzu, and he's a Shit-Tzu, too, from Atlanta. So she has over 50,000 followers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And Luigi's doing very well, too. So they went on this date.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's creepy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Their moms arranged a date, and they went to the Gramercy Park Hotel, all dressed up. They had champagne.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is going to make my wife mad. They go on better dates.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is the point, Greg. And this is the point: that men in New York City could learn a lot from the puppy love here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Puppy love.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No word yet...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: People in America are throwing up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... if there's going to be -- look at the Mercedes, too. I love it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Ready for this? It's been a while. What do I have?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dana's Corny Joke of The Day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. 1, why did the turkey cross the road?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: To get to the other side. That was a trick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To get the other sides.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, because it was Thanksgiving day, and he wanted people to think he was a chicken.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, his was better.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Mine was better. To get to the other sides. Thank you. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Excuse me, you improved on mine by adding an "S."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, please.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was pretty good. Because...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You just thought it was the original joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: ... he wanted them to think he was a chicken. OK. No. 2, what happened when the turkey got into a fight?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Bok. Bok.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The turkey got into a fight, what happened to him?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: No idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He got the stuffing knocked out of him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I like that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You like the violence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. No. 3, the final one.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What did the nut say when it was chasing the other nut? I'm going to cashew.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I knew! I was going to say "cashew."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You didn't say it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You didn't say it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I thought it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Doesn't count, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: God knows. God knows.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's her best one, about the jalapeno.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jalapeno.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. It's time for my favorite segment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Greg's Cow Brush News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not to be seen on CNN, because they can't handle the truth. All right. Let's go to Switzerland, shall we? Hapsburg, to be exact-sburg. Brolina (ph) the dairy cow lives on a farm in Hapsburg. She doesn't even know, because she's a cow. She could be living anywhere, because she's a cow. They don't have big brains. But she loves nothing more than brushing her coat. Look at her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Feels good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And that's a coat brush installed at the Hapsburg farm. And her owner, Marina, could not have expected a happier cow. The reaction is mind-blowing. The footage goes on for 37 hours. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me get this straight. It's a car wash for cows?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a brush for a cow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's a brush. It's, like, to make them feel better. Like you know, like an automatic brush for the cow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: For more cow brush news, wait.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: New York City getting dressed up for the holidays. It's beautiful. Sixth Avenue right now covered with barricades, even as we speak, because tomorrow -- for a very happy reason, all this -- the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. This year, new balloons will be floating through the skyscraper canyons of New York, including Olaf from "Frozen"...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Boo.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The "Paw Patrol" and the Grinch. Not Gutfeld. The Grinch. Alongside returning stars like Spongebob and Hello Kitty. The parade, by the way -- I didn't know this -- started in 1934, and it costs more than $13 million, estimated 3.5 million spectators in person. Fifty million will be watching at home.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Is there Underdog? Is Underdog coming back?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think he's back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're telling me we've got to go. That's it for us. Tomorrow night, don't miss our Thanksgiving special. It's at 5 p.m. Eastern. It's a really fun show. We hope you will join us. And here is something to whet your appetite. Thanks to FiveFanPhotoShop, we have a very happy Thanksgiving photo of the five of us having a fake dinner.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, how cute.
