utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, FORMER PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I don't have any personal stake in this presidency. I have a citizen's stake. I am, as you might guess, very much worried by the actions and rhetoric of our current president. I've been very disappointed in the way that he has conducted himself.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She went on to suggest that Hugh Hewitt, that racism in America has become more politically acceptable in the Trump era.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: I think there has proven to be more white supremacists and white nationalist than I wish there were in our country, as we saw tragically in Charlottesville and other places. And they have made common cause with the president's agenda out of their own mouths that he is someone that they are counting on to promote it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg, it's your lucky day. We start another show with Hillary Clinton. GREG GUTFELD, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: I can't get enough of her. Also -- conservative radio used to go after liberals. Not anymore. You notice that? BRIAN KILMEADE, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: Well, they don't go on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: That's what makes this news. For her to go on with Hugh Hewitt is outstanding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But, you know what? It's identity-driven politics that were created -- helped created by her cynical campaign that led to a lot of divisiveness. But she's swimming in what's called the big pool of fallacy. Trump will have some creepy fans because when you have a lot of fans, some of them are bound to be creepy. The bigger the pool, the more likely there might be a creep in that pool. However, you have to be cognizes if you're the lifeguard, should you say something? And I think one of the flaws with Donald Trump, it's a salesman's flaw. You never want just turned down a sale. It's actually not -- it's not a moral choice. It's not a correct choice, but it's a part of thinking that the money is green, so you never turn down a sale. You never know. You never condemn anyone until somebody else comes along. So there is a glimmer of truth here. But the other issue here is that the Democrats have a problem. Remember how they made Al Gore the president of global warming because they couldn't make him president. So they gave him something to keep him busy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They gave him a cause.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They gave him a cause so he couldn't hurt anybody. They've got to make a president or something, like the angry book club so that she go off and does something. Or she could be Bill Clinton's own defense attorney when those cases come up. She could interrogate Juanita Broaddrick. How good would that be?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If they hadn't had to close the Clinton global initiative, she could be doing that, but, of course, that's not available to her. Did you try to get Hillary Clinton on your radio show?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You've said she's not coming on.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Well, I didn't think she was going to come on. I know we're asking on Fox & Friends on a regular basis, it never happened. She had no interest when she was trying to be president of the United States on coming on. It's the biggest mistake that both Al Gore, John Kerry, who came on as secretary of state, and Hillary Clinton did make. Because if you come on, and Juan, as you know, if you went on you solve some of your best segments were on with people, and this show in particular, who disagree with you because you win people over and some of you don't, but at least you go in there and you'll get your hands dirty. And she in this interview said, Uranium One, that's still going on, and still everyone proves it didn't exist. Well, there's a problem with that. That story is moving. And she goes on the problems with my emails they made it the number one story. It shouldn't have been. Well, the problem is, there was a lot there, but you didn't go in and attack it. You know what she did, admitted it in this interview. I didn't even listen, nor did her staff. How do you know how to fight an uphill battle and win over independence if you don't know the other side even doing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think this is a real shortcoming for Democrats. I mean, you know, imagine the kind of flak I get being on Fox. But, they don't have a sense of the ability to come here and use this as a forum to influence people. So I think that's why it's great that she went on Hugh Hewitt show. And I think it's very important that you have sufficient respect for people, even if you disagree with them, to talk with them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'd love to have her on The Daily Briefing, in case you're watching, Hillary. But if you come on to a place where you're not necessarily going to be guaranteed a warm reception, and you're pleasant and you try to make a couple of good points, the viewer will say that is good. Like that was nice. She was kind. She was fine, whatever. And it's not a total train wreaked. KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, "THE FIVE" CO-HOST: No. I mean, you know, appreciate the upside there. If you believe in yourself and your confident in what you have to offer that you're a great candidate, and you have ideas that are compelling that would resonate with the American people, then why wouldn't she take a chance and get in the ring and go into a forum where you might be able to reach some of those crossover, or swing voters, or people -- independent that -- you know what I think? I feel more certain going with somebody like her. It could happen. The point is she didn't take that chance. And you would think, Brian, to your point, that other people made this same mistake, that they would learn. How many high paid consultants and experts does it take to figure it out when you have eyeballs and the reach of a network like the Fox News Channel and FBN, why wouldn't you take that opportunity? I don't get it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The one thing that really drives me crazy is that, and this would be true, if a conservative went on MSNBC and then complained on -- during the interview. Like, well, I know what network I'm on. She did that a few years ago and I've never forgotten it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: She used to go on when she was going against President Obama. And one of the things in the break she said is thank God for Fox, because we were the only one asking President Obama, when he was Senator Obama, legitimate questions. And we allowed -- it was one of the most.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She hated Obama. She hated.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know about that, but she did -- remember, she was his rival for the nomination.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And Bill hates him too.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. But I will say that what you got is a situation where she said, you know, this week that when Bill Clinton was running, if there had been a Fox News, that he wouldn't have been able to win because Fox News is so partisan. And I think I've heard from Obama the same thing, that Fox News just -- him, just attack him and stops.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: He won though, twice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm saying about the legislative agenda. That Fox News just makes him into this ogre, right? But at the same time, the reality is, if you're not talking to people, this goes back to your business about the salesman, then you're not selling. You're not out there making the pitch. They may feel unfairly attacked, but then show some goals, show up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She did make a comment about president Obama. In fact, we've played that one here.

utterances.speaker: CLINTON
utterances.utterance: It is true that when you run to succeed a two-term president of your own party, you have a historical headwind blowing against you. And I refer to that in the book because it's not just this campaign can be set apart from everything that's ever happened in our politics. It is a challenge.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Do you know what the problem is with this?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Permission to speak, Dana, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, go ahead. It's a free-for-all.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: She says it's hard to run as an agent of change when you come following someone like President Obama from your party. You know what you have to do? You have to say I, President Obama -- but this is what I would have done differently. I would do the economy differently. (INAUDIBLE) regulations I would said.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: When it comes to Syria, I would have done something different. In fact, I have a memo here that says on this date I recommended we started bombing, it would have prevented.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She did that in 2008 when she had to distance herself from Bill Clinton. And also, McCain had to separate from George W. Bush. Like that always happens. So what do you think will happen next time? Because the Democrats -- is still have her out there wanting to create a legacy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They've got to send her somewhere. They've got to send her somewhere.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did you see in the interview she said no one that is thinking about running in 2020 has reached out to her.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. And also, she also said that she doesn't think she could be friends with Donald Trump anymore. I guess she didn't mind his behavior when he was a Democrat or on the correct side of politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Giving your money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like her husband, who I think he could be friends with -- or Harvey Weinstein. She could be friends with him. And she could be friends to, on a far lesser extent, with Al Franken. Who, by the way, no one has yet to follow up on. Go on YouTube and Google Al Franken, Howard Stern, 1999, please.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No to Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is an interview there waiting to be discovered.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But see the difference? With President Trump they were all over, but they're not doing it with al Franken.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let's go back for a second to Hillary's interview with Hugh Hewitt.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because I think there're two things that were interesting to me. One is she says, guess what, the child health care insurance program that Trump is just letting it linger and die.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But congress is supposed to take that up before December.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But he, as the president, has some authority here, some voice, and he has said nothing in support of a program that will lead people, as she said, kids with diabetes and other illnesses to suffer. I think that's wrong. Second thing, Trump this very day retweets something that says Hillary is a corrupt blank. What is wrong with him?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's what he does. We've accepted this. What about Paul Manafort's house arrest?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That what I wanted to get to. We only have a minute left.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I'll say it real quick. He's under house arrest, which, by the way, everybody should want to be under house arrest. It's an excuse to not go to somebody's piano recital.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's your dream.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And also, the real punishment is he's not allowed to drink during it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know if he's not allowed -- no, I think that because he's getting a limited release from house arrest to travel on the condition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He doesn't drink.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That he doesn't drink.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. I'll take house arrest.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can he smoke?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can he smoke? I might take up smoking if I had to do that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, not you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely not. Take it back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She didn't say what she was smoking. It could some kind of like herbal cigarette, cloves. Those were big back in the day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We have a lot more to come.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've canceled the show.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, we're going to keep going because there's dramatic tape of a North Korean soldier desperate escape for freedom from his oppressive regime. Does he make it? Next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: This week, President Trump put North Korea back on the list of state sponsors of terror. Kim Jong-un is unhappy about it. The north calling it a serious provocation that justifies its need for nukes. The country is so oppressive, its own people don't want to live there. We want to show you some dramatic new video just released by the United Nations. We must warn you that it is disturbing. Last week, a North Korean soldier risked it all to escape from his country. He defected by trying to cross the heavily armed border with the south. When his comrades caught wind, they opened fire. He was hit several times and collapsed on the South Korean side. And what an amazing sight it was to see troops from the south pull him to safety. That soldier has thankfully regained consciousness after surgery, and is now reportedly enjoying American TV shows and movies in the hospital, and South Korean pop songs. What a story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Amazing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I actually tuned this in. I watched this on MSNBC and they played the tape backwards and claimed the South Korean guy was trying to escape to North Korea.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is such a good tape to see before Thanksgiving because everybody should be thankful they don't live in a country where people are dying to get out and aren't allowed to get out. I mean, this is a history lesson about tyranny. We talk about -- this poor guy was operated on and they found a parasitic worm the size of like a human arm in his stomach, which is an apt metaphor.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It is not rare, by the way, for North Korea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because they're eating -- the food that they eat is being raised in feces -- it is an apt metaphor for tyranny. It destroys from within. It shows you how unfair life is that if you're born here, you're going to make it.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You hit lotto.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you're born there, you're screwed. We have to remember that whenever we're speaking about people coming here, that they deserve a chance to come here. Whether you think it's -- we have to deal with national security and vetting, but we're lucky.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: So what you're saying is we should be looser on immigration and just do it the right way? Is that what you're saying?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm saying that we should do extreme vetting, but do not demonize people that are legitimately trying to escape horrible conditions.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: We've got plenty of room.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Is what you're saying.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Especially at your place in Long Island. You've got like 13 bedrooms.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's very spacious.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: you know they tell me I look at the diagram sometimes they get lost it so big. By the way, he has pneumonia, hepatitis b, and they say when they open him up he has blood poisoning. Even though he's watching television, they're not sure he's out of the woods yet.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No. But can you imagine that is part of the problem there, beside this despicable regime that they don't get proper medical care. I mean, literally, he's running, getting shot -- saved his life because look at all the medical conditions that he had. And the fact that he wouldn't to get any.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Getting shot saved his life.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what I'm saying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He might have known that he was dying.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what I'm wondering.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I hope we get a lot of intelligence from him, to the extent that he knew -- anything that he could from the military.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, he's only 24 years old. So he's not a high-ranking guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Freedom is universal. The desire to be free is something that every human is born with. And so, to the extent that we can help them get to a better place, we should.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I was just thinking though that, you know, and reading about this story, not only is he a young guy who made this tremendous effort, but it is said last time a soldier has escape from North Korea, ten years ago in '07, and that annually about 1,000 North Koreans flee the country. So they'll do anything to get out. Now the problem is most of them go through China. And guess what, one of the requests that people have right now is that China stop sending North Koreans back. But the Chinese are worried that if they don't send them back then there'll be a flood of refugees. And this gets back to what you were saying. These people deserve the opportunity. You believe in Democratic principles. If you believe in human rights, how can you turn your back?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Are you a neocon now?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Neocon? Shouldn't I believe in human rights?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, you said you have an obligation to do something. What should we do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe Donald Trump should have mentioned this when he was over there. He didn't say a word about human right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Neo-Juan. Neo-Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Neo-Juan.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing. With North Korea, and I believe we've said this on the break, I've always felt this, the biggest underreported story when we talk about North Korea is how horrible the conditions are for the North Koreans themselves. When we finally take the lid off that country, hopefully in this generation, we're going to say, what did we allow to happen? This is an ongoing holocaust with nobody getting fat except for the fat leader.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you think it is us or the Chinese? I think it's the Chinese.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Doing what?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Just keep a lid on it because they don't want to deal with it, and they especially don't want a reunified North Korea. They don't want north and south together.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right. I don't think they have great relations with North Koreans, but they have the best that there is right now, but I do think that there's an opportunity with the rest of the world. Believe it or now, he did not alienate anybody on this trip. I've read other accounts. I can't read Japanese like Greg, and I can't read Korean like Dana, but I was able to read the translation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Be better in English.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right. Let's be honest. So, you know, English overrated, very complicated, it's hard, especially with that contractions it kinds of throw me off. But when you look at the reviews and the relations that he built in that region you see that we're making progress. This vice is froing on this country. This is the first time we have a legitimate shot to make a change.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Why are you saying that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because China is actually playing ball.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're sending an envoy. Who knows what's going.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because he has nuclear weapons. There is no other option.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, exactly. I mean, and this guy has been firing off missiles at a greater rate than any other president before.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Little rocket man.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But now he says they're a terrorist state. That's the news today, right? OK, they're a terrorist state. What is that allow? It allows us to impose more sanctions. Hey, where are the Russians? You know, hats off.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: They had a 90 minute talk yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm just saying if he's Putin's pal, get Putin to say, hey.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now you want them to talk?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do, if it's going to help the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Neo-Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If Putin would stop -- if replacing the losses from the Chinese sanctions, maybe there would be more effect on them.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Maybe that happened yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, let's hope.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I have not seen that. They said they did talk about North Korea, but I think the president is smart enough to know I have to surround -- shut this circle off.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe we should say hats off to Rex Tillerson. You know what, Mr. President, I know how sensitive you are, thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think you're being serious.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Really lacks some sincerity. Try it again, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Try it again? If you coach me, I'll do it. Greg, what do you want me to do? How should I do it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Thank you, Mr. President.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, wait a minute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Holy smokes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That was sincere.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'll do it without the touch. Because you have a unique touch. Thank you -- how about this? Thank you. Thank you, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. I think that will work for me. Coming up, anti-Trump comedian Sarah Silverman has had a revelation about all of you so-called deplorables out there. Greg is going to fill you in next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Great news. She likes you. She really likes you. She, being the leftie comic, Sarah Silverman, and you evil Trump voters. Yes, after so much hate and bile, she finally realized you people aren't so bad. In fact, you might even be people. I guess she'll let you live. In a new show, Sarah travels the country interviewing groups who don't live near Whole Foods. It's like wild kingdom for gender studies majors. And now she claims after meeting so many Trump voters, she likes them. She loves them. Yes, what a surprise. You can feel comfortable around people who you don't agree with. So this is progress for a progressive, especially one who called for a military overthrow of Trump, a coup, while actual riots were going on. Imagine if anyone had listened. So this is a big step. For a progressive, the personal is always political, where the right isn't just wrong but evil. So good for Sarah for deciding that you're OK. You've met the approval of someone paid to talk to you. She appreciates you the way a cat appreciates yarn. Would her new enlightenment hold? I don't know. I remember how Sarah ridiculed Andrew Breitbart, not to his face, but when she took his seat after he left the set on Bill Maher's show.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: How are you?

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's sticky here.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yes, there was.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: In general.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, right. You're not just saying the conservatives.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, that was classy. She was nice to him in the green room, but then did that when he's not around. But it proves her point. It's easy to be a jerk to someone when they're not there. Wrapped in a cocoon of confirmation bias, it's easy to hate millions of people, and over time for them to hate you back. But I hope that Sarah's changed. Truly. Anything would be an improvement. I'm going to be positive about this, Kimberly. I think that maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Positive is OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. Maybe she's woke, as the left says. But she realized that just because you have a disagreement, it doesn't make them evil.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: OK. Well, this is why people have to have an open mind and actually listen to others in their viewpoints and try to understand and find common ground instead of being discriminating and having biases against other individuals that you're not even taking the time to listen to. So, I mean, I don't know. Hope springs eternal. Who knows? But at least -- maybe it's an example to some people that they might want to reconsider, just like all the people that were horrific, you know, to the women that accused Bill Clinton that are now coming out and say, oh, wait a second, we want to apologize for that. We were wrong with what we did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Dana, we were going to show a clip of this, but we weren't allowed -- we weren't able to get approval.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: From Hulu?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. From -- I don't know who.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Silverman Inc.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Vulture. I think it's called Vulture. I don't know what that means. Anyway, do you think she's sincere or she's just doing her job?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I read a feature story about her several months ago as she got this series underway. She talked about what she hoped to achieve. And it's really not -- it isn't that easy to publicly admit that you were wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Or that you have some work to do, or that you have to go out. So perhaps it is sincere. But I also think she's supposedly a comedian. So one of the best ways to have a relationship with people that maybe you don't agree with is through humor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And just laugh about it. Politics is really not that important.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It shouldn't be. Actually, that's a great point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You seem surprised.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am surprised.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She made good points in the earlier show, the show with her name on it. We get the leftovers. We get the turkey sandwiches. We don't get the turkey.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I know the feeling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Brian, the point is, if politics takes a large part of your life and you can be very angry, you have a lot of hobbies. So you play soccer with kids. You coach. Fox & Friends is only a tiny part of your life.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Do I have to agree with your premise? I don't even like -- did you even ask a question? First off, a disclaimer: he knows nothing about me. When he sees me in the green room, he walks the other way.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Did you hear what he said about your hair machine in your office the other night? It was, like, nuts.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I did not know that until now. I've got to get that DVR adjusted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I get all my information from Doocy.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Thanks for watching, though. That's twice.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: That's good. By the way, I've got to go to Blockbuster and get the episode, which day it was. It will be fantastic. By the way, she goes on to say in this story, where she says, "We haven't changed each other's minds, but I like these Trump people." I think it's a business decision. When asked about Trump, "We're waiting for him to hit bottom. There is no bottom. He doesn't understand what happiness is. If he isn't ruining people's lives and destroying the planet, my heart would break for him. He's a damaged, damaged person." I don't see much conversion here or much open-mindedness.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But I like you. I like the people that voted for you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He is far happier than she has any idea. He's very happy.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: He doesn't have a care in the world.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He has a good time. He has a nice family, lots of grandkids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Here's my cynical observation. She called for a military overthrow of Donald Trump, and I think she's seeing that her career is kind of, like, going down. And she realizes maybe alienating half of the country is a bad idea.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow, I didn't get that at all. In fact, I think she's been around in recent days promoting this new show...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... and having some success promoting it. I don't know how well the show does, but no, I don't have that impression. This is more like Thanksgiving dinner to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This is like oh, you know, so Uncle Joe walks in with the "Make America Great Again" hat.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And so am I supposed to, like, just be mocking? Should I be like, you know, oh, I can't stand this guy or whatever? And then it turns out, hey, Joe is a pretty good guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We just have some serious political disagreements. And let me tell you, I think you can have serious political fear even of Donald Trump and his presidency, but the idea that you would talk -- this is what we were discussing earlier. This is a good thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's a good thing. But I -- it's a good thing when you're not paid to do it. And it's like, so now she's doing it because she's got a salary. And she wouldn't have done this before.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: She sees Kathy Griffin, and Kathy Griffin is -- was one of the hottest comedians around. And now she has -- she's so angry.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She shaved her head.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: She can't get on CNN. She's yelling at Andy Cohen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But the funny thing is, she's claiming Hollywood is blacklisting her over Trump. Excuse me? Hollywood hates Trump. I mean...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Exactly. How does that make sense, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It doesn't make any sense. It doesn't make -- I think she's just whining, because -- what, was she on Bravo?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She wasn't, like, the biggest comedian. She was a train wreck.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way -- by the way, you know, she was doing this tour with Frank Rich. He used to write...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: ... for The Times and write for New York Magazine. So it's not as if Frank Rich -- I don't think Frank Rich is a Trump fan.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Hates him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. So my impression is this was her speaking from the heart, and I would think that, from your perspective, I know you're glad to have Hillary around.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love her.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Glad to have -- glad to play identity politics, grievance politics resentment. But I mean, goodness gracious, give the lady some credit.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Give who credit?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's one of three people that blocked me on Twitter.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Who?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Alec Baldwin, Keith Olbermann and Sarah Silverman blocked me on Twitter. That is like having three little medals. Little medals.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Look at how excited you are.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But I do think it's going to boomerang. I think people -- the anti-Trump stuff is getting so staid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I look for things to change. When you invite me back next year at this time, the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, we're going to talk about how people are taking on the Democratic Party on stage.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes? Or is that after we discuss impeachment?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "South Park" -- "South Park" does not do any bashing on Trump, because they say it's so predictable and hackneyed. All right. He managed to hold his fire for more than 24 hours, but President Trump let loose today on the dad who refuses to thank him. That's next.

utterances.speaker: LAVAR BALL, FATHER OF LIANGELO BALL, FREED FROM CHINESE PRISON
utterances.utterance: Maybe we was doing some talking with some other people before he even got there. I've got doubts of what he did do. How's that? If I was going to thank somebody, I would probably thank President Xi.

utterances.speaker: CUOMO
utterances.utterance: Somebody did something for you, you say thank you.

utterances.speaker: BALL
utterances.utterance: I would have said "thank you" if he would have put them on his plane and took them home.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's just...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: As you can imagine, those comments did not go over very well with President Trump. He was fired up this morning on Twitter, aiming his fire at LaVar Ball for dismissing his pivotal role in helping to bring his son and two others home from China. They were caught shoplifting. The president writes, quote, "It wasn't the White House, it wasn't the State Department, it wasn't father LaVar's so-called people on the ground in China that got his son out of a long term prison sentence - IT WAS ME."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: "Too bad! LaVar is just a poor man's version of Don King" -- oh, my goodness -- "but without the hair. Just think LaVar, you could have spent the next 5 to 10 years during Thanksgiving with your son in China" -- did I say that right? I want to do the Trump sounding...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: CHI-na.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: CHI-na.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: CHI-na.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: "... but no NBA contract to support you. But remember LaVar" -- is this a book? What am I reading? -- "shoplifting is not a little thing."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Two hundred and eighty characters.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's what?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Two hundred and eighty characters.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. Oh, that's right. Yes, Dana's been complaining. "It's a really big deal, especially in China. Ungrateful fool!" Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. That was a lot of dramatic acting.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's my interpretation. So let me ask you something.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's the best you've ever sounded.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you, sir. But Dana...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And you had fun. Do you know what it's like -- happy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It makes you happy. You enjoy this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You love being Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We all saw it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You and Sarah Silverman (ph).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It is fun to read his tweets out loud. It just is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But it's so ridiculous that this is the president.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You can't use that argument anymore. The bar isn't lowered. The bar is gone. Even Shakespeare knew that not every play had to be a tragedy. And that's the way the White House is now. The White House can actually be fun. Politics can be fun, the president can be fun. By the way, the only thing -- the big point here is when we look at historical artifacts of the past like letters written by Washington or letters written by Lincoln or Martin Luther King, no more. We're not going to have that anymore.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everything is going to be up on Twitter. There's going to be no parchment paper with stuff. Every thought and every feeling, every attack is going to be highly readable. It's going to be immortal and worthless.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Excuse me. You mean like the Gettysburg Address? And this stuff...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes, Twitter replaces that. You don't need it anymore.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Just a Twitter address.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Juan asked Dana to talk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but his point was so mundane that I haven't...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Are you still talking?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can't stop. Let -- let the lady have the floor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's sexist. "Let the lady have the floor"? This isn't a dance club.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right, all right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let me have the -- let me have the chair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let the gender-neutral individual -- gender-neutral individual...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think he's playing Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He loves -- he loves talking about Trump. He loves it. He loves when Trump does...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, I don't like the 280 characters. I thought he had a better rhythm at 140. Like, a self-imposed discipline on that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Even if it's three tweets. I thought those were much more fun to read. I also feel like, for as much as President Trump is entertaining his base, LaVar Ball is doing the same.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Everyone has an audience here, and so it's like the -- it is like the reality show. Because I can't wait to tune in tomorrow to see what's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But what would really get President Trump going might be if LaVar Ball thanked Hillary Clinton for some reason.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then we can keep it going.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You're giving ideas.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I have -- I have two thoughts on this. You have to watch the entire interview. I think he was putting Cuomo on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Of course, definitely.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: People say, "Oh, he's crazy, he's unhinged, he's not real." He went on there. He -- he twisted the thing. He put it on its head. He was Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And I've got to give Mark Cuban credit.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We said that yesterday.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Mark Cuban said Donald Trump and LaVar Ball are really the same.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I said that on "The Five" yesterday. Cuban took it from me.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: In reality, if the president didn't -- no one was pressuring the president to deal for these basketball players. But had he not, they might be in the same slot as that Ball State football player that's been in jail for 13 months for a bar fight in China, who cannot get anyone's attention. His family...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's his name?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: ... is putting -- his family -- I have it right here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, why didn't he get him out, too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He should have.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: His name is Wendell Brown. And his family says, "Mr. President, we will thank you every day if you can get my son out."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's real.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've got to get Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: President Trump, get Wendell Brown out. Please.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Free Wendell Brown. Free Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Free Wendell Brown. Free Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: He might be watching.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Certainly. Well, he certainly watches "FOX & Friends."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Because you're here. "FOX & Friends."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Wendell Brown.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What about this -- what about LaVar as Don King?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's pretty funny.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, you think it's funny? OK.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, he said Don King without the hair.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I thought he liked him.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes, Don King's a friend of his.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He does. That's why..

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Don King's a Republican.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Don King is his friend. Don King supported him and showed up at his -- so his was trying to -- this guy thinks he's, you know, funny.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: So you think it's over?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: ... original.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. It's too good. We just did a whole segment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's never over.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We've done it two days in a row on this show. It's not over.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It's your serve, Mr. Ball.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you know, what point, what Trump is saying, he recognizes that Ball is a showman in progress. When he said "a poor man's Don King", he was basically saying, "I know what you're doing."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: "I can help you."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "I can help you. I see where you're going." Because a lot of people call me a poor man's Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's only a matter of time.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Or they call you a poor man.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Everybody says it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's written in the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: By the way, they took -- they didn't just take glasses. They took a lot of stuff, by the way. They could've ended up in a lot of trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: They took a lot of paraphernalia.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's a serious thing. And he did do something wonderful. And, you know, LaVar Ball. Blah, blah, blah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And also, the president on the plane, when he gets asked about it on the flight home, he goes back to see the press, and there's that video. And the president is very restrained in talking about how bad the situation was. And I love -- it was at one point, where he said, "It wasn't good, OK?" He just leaves it at that, and everybody could have just left it at that. Instead, now we have to go over and over it again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm having a great time talking about it. I'd rather talk about this than a lot of other things.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I had fun with that ridiculous tweet, but I must say, I think he has saw self-interest in making himself into the hero of getting the boys back. But now LaVar is trying to thwart that. That's why he's going after LaVar. I don't know. To me, it just looks like two hucksters having a party. Coming up, new greeting recommendations for children during this holiday season. Forget the hugging. How about the high five? We'll explain next.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: All right. How about a high five, Grandpa? The Girl Scouts of America have just issued a warning to parents not to force kids to hug their relatives on the holidays, specifically daughters. Now the group posting a reminder online that says, quote, "Girls don't owe hugs to anyone, not even family members." It suggests the alternatives might be a smile, an air kiss -- are you writing this down, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: An air kiss or whatever is most comfortable for them. Kimberly, is this an important move?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Give an air kiss? Be, like, phony or whatever. And try to -- I don't get this.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Should you tell a 12-year-old to go hug a relative if they're not comfortable with it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes, absolutely. This is why I'm so happy that Dana and I chose to be Campfire Girls.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They would never issue such a foolish, ridiculous statement as the Girl Scouts.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Dana Perino, is this an evolving of our culture to realize we shouldn't just hug people just because they're technically related to us?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm a hugger. I like to hug.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You're a hugger?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I am, and I think that it -- I think it's good. I'm just trying to remember, like, if you see your family once a year, and it was, like, maybe Christmas time. You get up to the ranch, and there's Uncle Joe. I actually did have an Uncle Joe. Like, I want to give Uncle Joe and Aunt Lina a hug.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Of course. It's one moment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Isn't that...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Even if his "Make America Great Again" hat falls off during that hug. Juan, real quick, do you see this as evolving? People worried about 12- and 13-year-old girls may be in an uncomfortable situation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, and I would...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: You like this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't like it because I have granddaughters and a daughter. And I...

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And you want to get a hug.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Would you tell them not -- don't hug?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I would -- I'm very sensitive to the -- if a little kid said to me, "I'm not comfortable," I would say, "Why is that?" Because I think little kids want to hug you and give you a kiss.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think that's different.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I just...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's complaining about something that maybe has gone on a bit, you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe. I don't know what's going on, but if the child is uncomfortable, I would...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I would never force somebody.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I would -- I would listen to the child. Because if you look at the statistics, the people who are most likely to assault or attack that child...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my gosh. Now it's gone off the rails.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And they say one in nine -- one in nine females will have some type of unacceptable interactions with an adult. Greg, finally, think about the adult's feelings. A little kid -- young girl does not want to hug the cousin from another state, because "I haven't seen them." They don't feel comfortable. What about the adults' feelings?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two things. One, I am for this. I hate hugging, especially kids when they're already taller than me. It's a reminder.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Happens a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it happens way too often. You know, this is actually -- to be -- serious point, we are entering this phase where there's this underlying agreement that all men are predators. We're seen -- no matter what. We're just all bad. And I think this is the consequence of that. Of course, I doubt there will be any hugging at Uncle Franken's House. They'll be not hugging. And also Uncle Charlie's.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And no sleeping. Keep your eyes open.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And Uncle Roy, too.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I will say this. For Italian families in Girl Scouts, it's a no-brainer. Italians have to hug. It's the law.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Hug.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: They were born to hug. The Irish will welcome this. The Irish are not big emotional.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That should be your memoir, "Born to Hug."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think the Irish are very warm.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Not big huggers.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I hug people.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: "One More Thing" is next. On behalf of the Irish, we don't hug.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We hug.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "One More Thing." And in a spirit of generosity, Brian, you get to go first.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: All right. So in the next two weeks, "Andrew Jackson: The Miracle of New Orleans" will go on the big screen. It will be on the Fox News Channel at 8 p.m. either this Sunday or next Sunday or the Sunday after. The third or tenth. And Andrew Jackson, as you know, had a big win. It was for America. It's a pro-history story. Here's a look.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: If this berm didn't work, there was another line and another line they'd have to go through before they get into New Orleans, but they never got past this one.

utterances.speaker: DAVID BRINKLEY, PRESIDENTIAL HISTORIAN
utterances.utterance: That's right. This becomes a bloodbath here, the corpses. Now we're just looking at green grass. It was the beginning of the end of Britain and, in many ways, the birth of modern America.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And that's the story of the battle. We fly a drone above it to give you an idea. "Andrew Jackson: Miracle of New Orleans."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That looks great. Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Yes, it was a lot of fun.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Congratulations.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Ron Bredesen (ph) and Dave Brinkley did a great job.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're good photos.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. So I have a fantastic little thing of puppy love. "Kimberly's Puppy Love Dating Tips," OK? So this is cute. My friend Anisha has a dog Luigi who I absolutely love.
